required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Guo's Entry Tear Repair :The First in Man Study of Endopatch System
clinical_study.official_title: Guo's Entry Tear Repair :The First in Man Study of Endopatch System

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective, single-center, first in man study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Endopatch System manufactured by Hangzhou Endonom Medtech Co., Ltd. for the Chronic Stanford B type aortic dissection proximal tear.

primary_outcome.measure: No major adverse events within 30 days after surgery.
primary_outcome.description: Major adverse events within 30 days after operation refer to all-cause death, myocardial infarction, ischemic stroke, respiratory failure, liver failure, renal failure, intestinal necrosis, paraplegia, and amputation within 30 days after operation. Among them, renal failure refers to long-lasting dialysis, kidney transplantation, or other fatal results. Intestinal necrosis is intestinal ischemia that requires bowel resection or other fatal consequences. Severe lower limb ischemia refers to new severe limp or resting pain after surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: The success rate of entry tear closure 6 months after operation.
primary_outcome.description: The success rate of rupture closure at 6 months is a composite index, including immediate technical success after the operation and no leakage of the rupture sealed by the DSA 6 months after the operation, no displacement of the patch, and no second occurrence during the follow-up period. Second surgical intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: All-cause mortality, aortic dissection-related mortality, serious adverse events, and device-related adverse events.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, and 12 months after operation

secondary_outcome.measure: False lumen thrombosis of the descending thoracic aorta 1 month, 6 months, 12 months after operation
secondary_outcome.description: False lumen thrombosis of the descending thoracic aorta 1 month, 6 months, 12 months after operation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of false lumen diameter in descending thoracic aorta 1 month, 6 months, 12 months after operation
secondary_outcome.description: Change of false lumen diameter in descending thoracic aorta 1 month, 6 months, 12 months after operation.

clinical_study.condition: Chronic Stanford B Type Aortic Dissection Proximal Tear

arm_group.description: Participants will be treated with Endopatch System

intervention.description: The patch system for aortic dissection tear is composed of a dissection tear patch system and an adjustable bend conveyor. The patch system is composed of a patch and a conveying steel cable. The patch is pre-installed on the conveying steel cable.
